# layout() | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ RealityKit ](/documentation/realitykit)

- [ ARView ](/documentation/realitykit/arview)

- [ layout() ](/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/layout())

- [ ARView ](/documentation/realitykit/arview)

-  layout() 

Instance Method# layout()

macOS

```
@MainActor @preconcurrency
override dynamic func layout()
```

## [See Also](/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/layout()#see-also)

### [Managing the view](/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/layout()#Managing-the-view)

[`var frame: NSRect`](/documentation/realitykit/arview/frame)The frame rectangle, which describes the view’s location and size in the coordinate system of the view’s superview.[`var contentScaleFactor: CGFloat`](/documentation/realitykit/arview/contentscalefactor)The scale factor of the content in the view.[`func didMoveToSuperview()`](/documentation/realitykit/arview/didmovetosuperview())Tells the view that its superview changed.[`func didMoveToWindow()`](/documentation/realitykit/arview/didmovetowindow())Tells the view that its window property is set to a new value.[`func layoutSubviews()`](/documentation/realitykit/arview/layoutsubviews())Lays out subviews.[`class var layerClass: AnyClass`](/documentation/realitykit/arview/layerclass)The class used to create the layer for view instances.[`func makeBackingLayer() -> CALayer`](/documentation/realitykit/arview/makebackinglayer())Creates the view’s backing layer.[`func viewDidChangeBackingProperties()`](/documentation/realitykit/arview/viewdidchangebackingproperties())Tells the view when its backing store properties change.[`func viewDidMoveToSuperview()`](/documentation/realitykit/arview/viewdidmovetosuperview())Tells the view that it has a new superview or that the view’s superview has been removed.
